BRCA1.function: Tumor suppressor involved in DNA double-strand break repair via homologous recombination.
hotspots: C-terminal BRCT domain (pathogenic truncations are enriched)
BRCA1.clinical_relevance: Germline BRCA1 variants confer high risk of hereditary breast and ovarian cancer; used in clinical genetic testing.

BRCA2.function: DNA repair protein that partners with BRCA1 and PALB2 in homologous recombination.
hotspots: Large exon 11 region with many loss-of-function variants
BRCA2.clinical_relevance: Germline BRCA2 variants increase risk of breast, ovarian, pancreatic and prostate cancers.

PALB2.function: BRCA2-interacting protein that anchors BRCA2 to DNA damage sites, enabling homologous recombination.
PALB2.clinical_relevance: Moderate-to-high risk hereditary breast cancer gene; PALB2 loss can influence PARP inhibitor sensitivity.

CDKN2A.function: Encodes p16INK4a and p14ARF, key regulators of the G1/S cell cycle checkpoint and p53 pathway.
hotspots: Exon 2 region shared by p16INK4a and p14ARF
CDKN2A.clinical_relevance: Frequently deleted or mutated in familial melanoma and pancreatic cancer; key tumor suppressor locus.

STK11.function: Serine/threonine kinase that regulates cell polarity and energy sensing pathways (including AMPK).
STK11.clinical_relevance: Germline variants cause Peutz–Jeghers syndrome; somatic loss is seen in lung adenocarcinoma and other tumors.

KRAS.function: Small GTPase in the RAS/MAPK pathway, acting as a molecular switch for growth factor signaling.
KRAS.clinical_relevance: Oncogene; KRAS hotspot mutations predict lack of response to anti-EGFR therapy and drive multiple solid tumors.

EGFR.function: Receptor tyrosine kinase that controls cell proliferation and survival in response to growth factors.
EGFR.clinical_relevance: Target of EGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitors in non-small cell lung cancer; activating mutations guide targeted therapy choices.

TP53.function: Master tumor suppressor regulating DNA repair, apoptosis, and cellular stress responses.
TP53.clinical_relevance: Most frequently mutated gene across human cancers; important for prognosis and experimental targeted therapies.

SMAD4.function: Central mediator of TGF-β signaling, forming transcriptional complexes that regulate cell fate decisions.
SMAD4.clinical_relevance: Frequently inactivated in pancreatic and colorectal cancers; lost in a subset of juvenile polyposis cases.
